definition: escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu
to leave oneself a way out
to outflank and attack from the rear

sentences.english: Objective To introduce the new methods of posterior approach for the atlantoaxial instability.
sentences.chinese: 目的介紹寰樞椎不穩的後路內固定治療的新方法。

sentences.english: But just at that time, Gou Jian, king of the State of Yue, outflanked Fu Chai and attacked him in the rear.
sentences.chinese: 可正在這個時候，越王勾踐抄了吳王的後路。

sentences.english: The defence industry should take cover.
sentences.chinese: 國防工業應該給自己找後路了。

sentences.english: 'I have to cover my bases if the government decides it needs to punish China,' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他說，我必須爲政府可能決定懲罰中國留條後路。

sentences.english: Next I recommend that you do not directly or indirectly burn any bridges.
sentences.chinese: 下一步我建議你不要直接或間接自斷後路。

sentences.english: He always taught me, everything left posterior section.
sentences.chinese: 他總教我，凡事留條後路。

sentences.english: He doesn't bring you out on a limb and then cut off the limb.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有把你帶到孤立無援的窘境，而又把後路切斷。

definition: nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
to lay one's cards on the table
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to die peacefully/(fig.) to result in failure (without any outside interference)/to come to nothing/to fizzle out
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
to look for trouble
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
to stop/to obstruct
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
to defect/to betray/to mutiny
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
idle gossip
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
